40 Vita sancti Cri&slong;tofo&rrot;i.
SEint Cri&slong;tofre was a saracen &punctelev; in þe londe of canaan Canaan
In none &slong;tude bi is daie &punctelev; nas so gret a man
Foureandtwenti fet he was long &punctelev; and þicke and b&rrot;od inouȝ
A scwuch bote he were &slong;trong &punctelev; me þinchez it were wouȝ
Al a contreie þare he were &punctelev; fo&rrot; him wolde fleo
Þarefo&rrot;e him þouȝte þat noman &punctelev; aȝen him scholde beo
He seide he nolde with no man bileue &punctelev; bote with on þat were
hext louerd ouer alle men &punctelev; and onder non oþur nere
Swuch a Man he wente to seche &punctelev; and so þat men him tolde
Of þe hexte manne þat on eo&rrot;þe was &punctelev; and of me&slong;t power iholde
Seint Cri&slong;tofre souȝte feo&rrot; &punctelev; and atþe la&slong;te he cam him to
Þe king axede him anon ȝwat he were &punctelev; and ȝwat he souȝte also
Cri&slong;tofre him seide ȝwat he was &punctelev; and þat he serui wolde
Þene hexte Man þat ouȝwere were &punctelev; and þat non oþur abouwie ne scholde
Ȝif he miȝte ani scw&ydot;ch[o&rrot;ig. scwuch] finde &punctelev; þis king to him sede
Þat he ne heold of no man &punctelev; ne abouwie he nolde ne d&rrot;ede
Eiþur was of oþur glad &punctelev; Cri&slong;tofre him seruede longue
Þe k&ydot;ng louede muche Melodie &punctelev; of fieþle[r. fiþele] and of songue
So þat is Iugelour a da&ydot; &punctelev; bifo&rrot;e him pleide fa&slong;te
And nemde in is r&ydot;me and in is song &punctelev; þene deuel atþe la&slong;te
Anon so þe k&ydot;ng þat iheo&rrot;de : he blessede him anon
Seint Cri&slong;tofre nam wel guode ȝeme &punctelev; and nolde ane fot feo&rrot; gon
Are he wu&slong;te ȝwi it were. &punctelev; þe king was ful loth to telle
Cri&slong;tofre seide "bote þou me segge &punctelev; no leng serui þe Inelle
Þo þe k&ydot;ng ne isaiȝ non oþur &punctelev; leoue Cri&slong;tofre he sede
Ich blessede me þo ich heo&rrot;de him nemme &punctelev; fo&rrot; ich habbe of him gret d&rrot;ede
Þanne he is quath Cri&slong;tofre &punctelev; herre Mai&slong;ter þane þou
Þat ne ma&ydot; ich quath þe k&ydot;ng &punctelev; fo&rrot;soþe fo&rrot;sake nov
Haue guod da&ydot; quat Cri&slong;tofre þo &punctelev; Inelle neuereft with þe beo
Ichulle seche þane deuel[MS. feond; deuel on the margin.] and serui him &punctelev; ȝif ich him owere iseo
Þe k&ydot;ng was so&rrot;i and alle his &punctelev; þat hu&ydot; ne miȝten him make abide
Fo&rrot;th he wende þene deuel to seche &punctelev; ake natheles nouȝt wel wide
Fo&rrot; þe schrewe wole euere aredi beo &punctelev; to heom þat beoth to him inome
Þo Cri&slong;tofre cam withoute toun &punctelev; gret folk he saiȝ come
wel on ho&rrot;se with grete noble&ydot;e &punctelev; sw&ydot;þe fierce and p&rrot;oute
Cri&slong;tofre heom mette we[l] baldeliche &punctelev; he nadde of heom no doute
Þe mai&slong;ter fiers withalle &punctelev; cam and mette with him anon
Beu sire he seide ȝwat art þou? &punctelev; and ȝwodere þenxt þou gon
Ich am a ma[n] opon mi seruiz &punctelev; and noman serui inelle
Bote mi louerd þat ich seche &punctelev; þe heiȝe deuel of helle
Beu frere quath þe oþur "ich it am &punctelev; welcome ar þov to me
Þe be&slong;te seruiz þat þou wolt cheose &punctelev; man schal deliueri þe
Cri&slong;tofre saiȝ is grete folk &punctelev; and þat he was of gret pouwer
Of swuch a louerd he was wel glad &punctelev; and also of þat grete me&slong;ter
Þe Mai&slong;ter heiȝte al is folk awei &punctelev; bote heomseoluen tweie
To teche him is me&slong;ter p&rrot;iueliche &punctelev; ase hu&ydot; wenden bi þe weie
Ase hu&ydot; wenden taleȝinde fo&rrot;th &punctelev; of þis luþere seruise
In þe wei heo iseien one croiz &slong;tonde. &punctelev; þe deuel gan þarof agrise
his wei in b&rrot;eres and in þo&rrot;nes &punctelev; wel feo&rrot; biside he nam
Þo heo þe croiz ipassede hadden &punctelev; aȝein to þe weie he cam
Cri&slong;tofre him Axede ȝwi it were &punctelev; and him was loth to telle
Certes he seide bote þou me segge &punctelev; no leng serui þe inelle
Cri&slong;tofre mi leoue freont quath þe deuel &punctelev; ichulle þe telle fa&ydot;n
with þat þou serui me afterward &punctelev; þe betere with al mi ma&ydot;n
with a swuch croiz ase we þare iseien &punctelev; þe heie god God þat was here
Ouer cam and in so&rrot;uwe b&rrot;ouȝte &punctelev; me and alle mine fere
Þanne is he herre quath Cri&slong;tofre &punctelev; and hath power mo&rrot;e
Þat ne ma&ydot; ich nouȝt fo&rrot;sake þe feond seide &punctelev; and þat me fo&rrot;þinchez so&rrot;e
Daþeit þanne Cri&slong;tofre seide &punctelev; þat leng beo in þine seruise
Ȝif ich of þane heie manne ma&ydot; oȝt iwite &punctelev; in anie kunnes wise
Fo&rrot;th he wende and souȝte o&rrot;e louerd. &punctelev; wel wide he gan gon
Atþe la&slong;te he fond ane hermite &punctelev; to him he wende anon
he tolde him clanliche alhou it was &punctelev; and hou he a sw&ydot;ch man souȝte
Ȝe seide þe heremite ihered he beo &punctelev; þat þe in sw&ydot;che wille b&rrot;ouȝte
Leue b&rrot;oþer seide þe heremite he is þi louerd &punctelev; fo&rrot; to manne he þe wrouȝte
And with is owene flechs and is blod &punctelev; wel deo&rrot;e he þe abouȝte
Þou mo&slong;t sumȝwat soffri fo&rrot; him &punctelev; and fe&slong;ten eche frida&ydot;
Ine fa&slong;te neuere seide Cri&slong;tofre &punctelev; ne certes ȝeot Ine ma&ydot;
Þou mo&slong;t seide þe heremite to churche gon &punctelev; and þine beden bidde also
Inot seide Cri&slong;tofre ȝwat it is &punctelev; ne ine can hit nouȝt do
¶No seide þe heremite þou art &slong;trong &punctelev; and here is a water biside
Þat no man ma&ydot; þareouer come &punctelev; bote he þe herre ride
Þou mo&slong;t in lesnesse of þine sunnes &punctelev; habbe þine woneȝingue þere
And ȝwane ani man to þe neode hath &punctelev; þareouer þou mo&slong;t him bere
In furȝiuenesse of þine misdedes &punctelev; he grauntede þat anon
Þe heremite ȝaf him cri&slong;tinedom &punctelev; and het him þudere gon
¶CRi&slong;tofre biside þulke watere &punctelev; one hole he made him þere
In his hond a long perche he bar &punctelev; is &slong;taf as þei it were
Ȝwane an&ydot; man wolde ouer þat watur &punctelev; opon is rug he him ca&slong;te
And tok is perche and bar him ouer &punctelev; he &slong;tap hardeliche and fa&slong;te
Fo&rrot; he was boþe &slong;trong and long &punctelev; þare ne cam so heui non
Þat Cri&slong;tofre ouer þe deope watere &punctelev; ne bar heom ouer echon
A niȝt in þe oþur half of þe watur &punctelev; a uoiz þare cam and gradde
Hale hale to seint Cri&slong;tofre &punctelev; þat he him þareouer ladde
Cri&slong;tofre aros him op anon &punctelev; is perche on honde he nam
And wod ouer þe waturand ne fond no man &punctelev; þo he to londe cam
he nas bote icome hom aȝen &punctelev; þat on ne gradde eftsone þer
Cri&slong;tofre wod ouer and ne miȝte finde &punctelev; non mo&rrot;e þane he dude er
Ȝu&ydot;t it gradde þe þridde t&ydot;me &punctelev; þo he cam hom to londe
And with is rodde wod aȝen &punctelev; a lu&ydot;te child he fond þare &slong;tonde
Þat child bad him par charite &punctelev; ouer þe watere him lede
Cum fo&rrot;th ȝif þou wolt here ouer" &punctelev; cri&slong;tofre Cristofre to him sede
Sw&ydot;þe liȝtliche þat child he nam &punctelev; and in is Armes it ca&slong;te
Euere ase he was ouerward &punctelev; it gan to heueg&ydot; fa&slong;te
And þat watur wax also &punctelev; þat Cri&slong;tofre so&rrot;e aga&slong;te
To ad&rrot;enche þat child þat was so heui &punctelev; vnneþe he &slong;tod atþe la&slong;te
Neuere so clene he nas ouercome &punctelev; at eche &slong;tape he grunte and bla&slong;te
And la&slong;te þat child hadde ad&rrot;eint &punctelev; he ne do&rrot;&slong;te it adoun ca&slong;te
Þo he was to londe icome : ase him þouȝte ful longue er
Þat child he sette adoun to grounde &punctelev; and &slong;tod op to re&slong;te him þer
Ȝwat art þou þat art so lu&ydot;te &punctelev; and so heui bicome
So heui þat ich was ope þe po&ydot;inte &punctelev; to habbe ad&rrot;eint ilome
Þei al þe wo&rrot;ld hadde ope me ileie &punctelev; me þinchez so heui it nere
No wonder cri&slong;tofre Cristofre seide þat child &punctelev; þei ic[MS. it] heuio&rrot;e were
Þane al þe wo&rrot;ld fo&rrot; ich [am] mo&rrot;e &punctelev; and no wonder it nis[andnis on an erasure.]
Fo&rrot; ich made al þe wo&rrot;ld of nouȝt &punctelev; and al oþur þin[g] þat is
And fo&rrot; þou schalt þe soþe iseo &punctelev; þine &slong;taf piche in þe grounde
And he schal bere lef and blowe &punctelev; and fru&ydot;t bere in lu&ydot;te &slong;tounde
With þis wo&rrot;d þat child wende fo&rrot;th. &punctelev; Cri&slong;tofre is &slong;taf nam
And piȝte hit in þe grounde amo&rrot;ewe &punctelev; and riȝt soth it þare bicam
Þo was he sikero&rrot;e þane he was er &punctelev; and o&rrot;e louerd he louede mo&rrot;e
Fo&rrot;th he wend[e] to siwi him &punctelev; and fo&rrot;to p&rrot;echi is lo&rrot;e
he heo&rrot;de telle ȝware Cri&slong;tine men &punctelev; In to&rrot;ment weren ib&rrot;ouȝt
To confo&rrot;ti heom he wende þudere &punctelev; þat heo ne scholden flechchie nouȝt
Beoth hardie he seide "and &slong;tudefa&slong;te &punctelev; and doth as ich ou lere
Þe Iu&slong;tise &slong;turte fo&rrot;th anon &punctelev; and smot him vnder þe Ere
Artþou he seide on of þulke &punctelev; þou it schalt aco&rrot;ie so&rrot;e
Site þou wel &slong;tille Cri&slong;tofre seide &punctelev; and ne smijt þou me nonmo&rrot;e
Fo&rrot; ȝif ich a cri&slong;tine man nere &punctelev; Ich me wolde awreke anon
Ȝe bileuez on ouwer Maumates he seide &punctelev; Imaket of treo and &slong;ton
Þat none Miracles ne mouwen do &punctelev; non mo&rrot;e þane a treo
Sum of þe power þat mi louerd hath &punctelev; bi mi &slong;taf þou schalt iseo
his rodde he piȝte in þe grounde &punctelev; and heo bigan anon
To leui and blowe and bere fru&ydot;t &punctelev; bifo&rrot;e heom euerechon
On swuch a god God ȝe schullen bileue &punctelev; þat swuch Miracle mai do
Þe Iu&slong;tise ne do&rrot;&slong;te fo&rrot; he was muche &punctelev; a bold wo&rrot;d segge him to
Fo&rrot; þe faire Miracle of is &slong;taf &punctelev; and fo&rrot; is p&rrot;echingue also
To god God heo[m][MS. heo] to&rrot;neden in þe place &punctelev; seuen þousende and mo
Toward amaner wildernesse : seint Cri&slong;tofre wende
In godes Godes seruise to lede is lijf &punctelev; ase o&rrot;e louerd him grace sende
Þe Iu&slong;tise tolde þe k&ydot;ngue fo&rrot;e &punctelev; of sw&ydot;ch a man þat he iseiȝ
Turne þat folk and he ne do&rrot;&slong;te &punctelev; fo&rrot; &slong;trencþe come him neiȝ
Þe king het sone to hund&rrot;et kniȝtes &punctelev; seche fo&rrot;to heo him founde
And þat hu&ydot; scholden him nimen and leden &punctelev; bifo&rrot;e him fa&slong;te ibounde
Fo&rrot;th wenden þis kn&ydot;ȝtes &punctelev; wel Iarmede anon
Toward Cri&slong;tofre hu&ydot; comen a lu&ydot;te &punctelev; and biheolden him echon
hu&ydot; alle ne do&rrot;&slong;ten come him neiȝ &punctelev; ake hamward hu&ydot; gonne fleo
And tolden þo hu&ydot; comen hom &punctelev; þat hu&ydot; ne miȝten him noȝwere iseo
Ouȝ ȝe cowardes quath þe king &punctelev; nabbe ȝe him nouȝt ifounde
Ichulle ȝif he aliue is : habbe him fa&slong;te ibounde
he sende to hund&rrot;et oþur kn&ydot;ȝtes &punctelev; þat h&ydot; him wide souȝte
And þat hu&ydot; ne comen neuere aȝen &punctelev; are hu&ydot; him with heom b&rrot;ouȝte
Wel Iarmede heo wenden fo&rrot;th &punctelev; and anon so hu&ydot; Cri&slong;tofre iseie
hu&ydot; &slong;toden and ne do&rrot;&slong;ten gon him ner &punctelev; oþur vnneþe biholden him with eiȝe
¶Cri&slong;tofre &slong;tod and him[r. hem] biheold &punctelev; and axede hem ȝwat hu&ydot; wolden
Fo&rrot; noþing ne do&rrot;re we þe kn&ydot;ȝtes seiden &punctelev; bi þe don þat we scholden
Þe king us het b&rrot;ingue þe to him &punctelev; and þine hondene fa&slong;te binde
Ȝif þou wolt we wollez him segge &punctelev; þat we ne mouwen þe finde
Na&ydot; certes seide Cri&slong;tofre þo &punctelev; ȝe scholden beo iblamede so
Ake with ou ichulle[MS. ichulle ichulle] gon &punctelev; and loki ȝwat he wulle habbe ido
he made heom al aȝein heo&rrot;e wille &punctelev; ase a þef fa&slong;te him binde
þat heo neren iblamede and leden him fo&rrot;th &punctelev; his hondene him bihinde
Of godes Godes lawe bi þe weie &punctelev; ri&slong;tofre heom gan so lere[MS. lerere]
Þat echone are hu&ydot; comen hom &punctelev; faire icri&slong;tnede were
Natheles hu&ydot; ladden him fo&rrot;th &punctelev; bifo&rrot;e þe k&ydot;ngue fa&slong;te ibounde
And seiden here is godes Godes kn&ydot;ȝt &punctelev; nouþe we him habbeth ifounde
þe king sat an heiȝ opon is sege &punctelev; and anon so he Cri&slong;tofre iseiȝ
Fo&rrot; d&rrot;ede he feol doun to grounde &punctelev; þat is necke tobar&slong;t neiȝ
his kn&ydot;ȝtes nomen him up anon &punctelev; and ase t&ydot;me ase is wit him cam
he bad Cri&slong;tofre to him take &punctelev; and leten beo is cri&slong;tindam
þou miȝt guode man seide
cri&slong;tofre Cristofre &punctelev; also wel beo &slong;tille
Mi bodi þou ha&slong;t here fa&slong;te ibounde &punctelev; þou miȝt don al þi wille
¶Certes sire þis kniȝtes seiden &punctelev; þat hadden him þudere ib&rrot;ouȝt
Cri&slong;tindom we habbez itake : and we nelleth it bileue nouȝt
þe king let þo in grete wrathþe &punctelev; Cri&slong;tofre in p&rrot;isone do
And binden alle þe kn&ydot;ȝtes fa&slong;te &punctelev; and heo&rrot;e heuedes smiten of also
þo þeos kn&ydot;ȝtes bihauedede weren &punctelev; þe king sone biþouȝte
And twe&ydot;en faire wommen withalle &punctelev; to cri&slong;tofre Cristofre he b&rrot;ouȝte
Þat on het Nice þat oþur Aquiline &punctelev; fo&rrot;to to&rrot;nen is mod
Þo þis wommen iseien Cri&slong;tofre &punctelev; ase he in p&rrot;isone &slong;tod
heom þouȝte is face wel b&rrot;iȝto&rrot;e schine &punctelev; þane þe sonne oþur þe Mone
Cr[i]&slong;tofre merci loude heo gradden &punctelev; make us cri&slong;tine sone
Cri&slong;tofre heom teiȝte þe riȝte bileue &punctelev; and cri&slong;tnede heom anon þere
Amo&rrot;ewe þe k&ydot;ing let heom fette &punctelev; to lokie hou it were
he hopede heo hadden þane guode man &punctelev; in lecherie ib&rrot;ouȝt
þe wommen Answereden to his Axingue &punctelev; as hu&ydot; ne tolden of him noȝt
Ȝwat hou goth þis quat þe k&ydot;ng &punctelev; habbe ȝe iturnd ower þouȝt
honourieth mine godes ich rede &punctelev; þe ȝw&ydot;le ou is wel iþouȝt[al. idoȝt]
Ouwer godes beoth wurþe þis Ma&ydot;denes seiden &punctelev; in fa[i]r &slong;tude honoured to beo
þarefo&rrot;e lat swope þe &slong;tretes faire &punctelev; þat al folk mouwe iseo
And we heom wollez honouri iwis &punctelev; ase riȝt is and lawe
þe king let don ase heo seiden &punctelev; swiþe sone and fawe
þo þis Maumates weren ib&rrot;ouȝt &punctelev; in þe &slong;trete at þe la&slong;te
þis ma&ydot;denes nomen heo&rrot;e gurdles boþe &punctelev; ant to heom teiden fa&slong;te
And tod&rrot;owen heom into al þe &slong;trete &punctelev; and heowen heom to peces þere
Goth heo seiden ant fechchiez heom leches &punctelev; þat heo ihelede were
Þe k&ydot;ing was neiȝ fo&rrot; wrathþe wod &punctelev; þat o maide he let hongue
And to hire fet b&ydot;nden heuie &slong;tones &punctelev; þat hire deþes þrowes weren &slong;trongue
Anon so þis ma&ydot;de was up id&rrot;awe &punctelev; hire leomes bo&rrot;&slong;ten withinne
Necke and senewes and oþur limes &punctelev; wel auȝte heo heuene iwinne
he let don þat oþur in &slong;trong fu&ydot;r &punctelev; ake þare ne miȝte non come hire neiȝ
Ake sethþe he let hire heued of smite &punctelev; þo he þat oþer cas iseiȝ
Þus þis twei holie ma&ydot;denes &punctelev; to þe blisse of heuene iwende
Þo&rrot;u þe grace þat o&rrot;e swete louerd &punctelev; fo&rrot; seint Cri&slong;tofre heom sende
¶Þe king let þo cri&slong;tofre Cristofre fecche &punctelev; and axede him anon
Ȝweþur he wolde his Maumates serui &punctelev; oþur to þe deþe gon
Cri&slong;tofre fo&rrot;sok heo&rrot;e Maumates &punctelev; and heo&rrot;e seruiz also
Þe king het anon þat Men him scholden &punctelev; opon a &slong;trong gredile do
And with &slong;trong fu&ydot;r and pich ro&slong;ti him &punctelev; and þo he was ileid þaron
As wex þat gredile malt awei &punctelev; and þat fu&ydot;r aque&ydot;nte anon
And he aros up withoute harme &punctelev; wroth was þe k&ydot;ng þo
To a piler he let him binde fa&slong;te &punctelev; and kn&ydot;ȝtes aboute him go
Fo&rrot;[to] scheoten him to deþe &punctelev; with Mani a kene flo
With bouwe and Arebla&slong;t þare schoten to him &punctelev; four hond&rrot;et kn&ydot;ȝtes and mo
Ake þare nas non Arewe þat neiȝ him cam &punctelev; ake alle heo gliden biside
And heo[n]gun[MS. heogun] in þe E&ydot;r aboute him &punctelev; and þare hu&ydot; gunne abide
Anon so þe king þis isaiȝ : fo&rrot; wratþe þudere he wende
